sentences.sentence: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky, his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan and the UN Secretary General Antonio Gutierrez met in Lviv, with the Zaporozhye nuclear power plant top of the agenda.

sentences.sentence: Erdogan conveyed a message on behalf of Russia, saying it is ready to negotiate peace.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Zelensky, however, was skeptical of this.

sentences.sentence: I am very surprised that they are ready for some kind of peace.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Another important issue is grain, with the UN Secretary General wanting to speed up humanitarian shipments of Ukrainian cereals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: For its part, Russia claims it targeted a temporary base of foreign mercenaries, killing 90 of them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, local authorities say two Russian villages were evacuated yesterday after a fire broke out at an ammunition depot near the border with Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And Russia says it's deployed warplanes armed with state-of-the-art hypersonic missiles to the country's Kaliningrad region, an enclave surrounded by two NATO nations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: As tensions rise between Serbia and Kosovo, the European Union has been trying to play mediator, but to no avail.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: A meeting yesterday between EU foreign policy chief Joseph Borrell and leaders from the two nations ended without reaching an agreement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Borrell says it's important for the two nations to normalize their relations, particularly given the current context.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: And this happened at the moment when we are in a critical time for Europe. We see the return of war to our continent after the Russia invasion of Ukraine. We are facing a dramatic and very dangerous moment for our continent. And this is not a moment for increasing tensions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Before meeting with Borrell, the two leaders met separately with NATO leader Jens Stoltenberg.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The latest tension follows Kosovo's decision that Serbian identity documents and vehicle license plates would no longer be valid in its territory. Belgrade has been implementing the same measures for people from Kosovo crossing into Serbia for years, saying accepting them would amount to recognizing its neighbor as an independent state.

sentences.sentence: Only 20% of services were running on Thursday and another strike is scheduled for Saturday. We've taken six days of strike action. The companies were going to make those redundancies many months ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
